venue.name: Center for Digital Imaging Arts at Boston University

item.description:
2012 Image Competition Friday, April 27, 6:30pm–9:30 pm

The Annual Image Competition provides members the opportunity to share their best work with the community and be recognized by their peers for excellence and creativity in the field of photography. The judging session is open to all Conference attendees, but competition entry is open to CIPNE members only.

The Business of Photography and Lighting Conceptually with Dan Saelinger Saturday, April 28, 9:30 am–12:30 pm

The first part of New York-based conceptual photographer Dan Saelinger’s Dan Saelinger presentation will cover business practices for emerging photographers, and will be especially useful for young photographers just entering the professional market or those looking to grow their careers. Dan will share career-changing advice and discuss the steps he took to build his own successful business in just five years. Topics include promotion, marketing, cash flow, real world estimates, billing, video production, running a commercial studio, and finding representation. In the second part Dan will share techniques he uses to photograph a wide range subjects from glassware to models while maintaining a consistent look and style. Topics will include Broncolor light modifiers, equipment choices, set materials, rigging and special effects. A demo lighting a conceptual still life set will be conducted during the duration of the discussion.

Portraits Under Pressure with Victoria Will Saturday, April 28, 1:30 pm–4:00 pm

Celebrity photographer Victoria Will Victoria Will discusses her lighting techniques for reading and shaping light for any type of portrait. Accustomed to working under tight time constraints, Victoria will share some of her secrets to working quickly on location or in the studio and talk about how to deal with clients in tricky situations while still getting what you need. “I had an assignment to photograph Justin Bieber last year. When it was all said and done—58 seconds after it began, I had shot him in two lighting set ups and had 22 frames to show for it.”

All-day Printing Workshop with Bob Korn Sunday, April 29, 10:00 am–5:00 pm

Spend the day fine-tuning and upgrading your printmaking with Master photographic and digital printmaker Bob KornBob Korn . Over the past thirty five years Bob has adapted to the constant change of techniques and technology, while developing an eye which can see color like no other. His prints can be found in every major collection throughout the world, including the Getty, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Modern Art, and the Smithsonian. A popular and sought-fater instructor, Bob has taught at SUNY-Buffalo, New England School of Photography, Maine Photographic Workshops, Santa Fe Workshops, and Center for Digital Imaging at Boston University, Bob continues to demonstrate his craft as the director and founder of The Workshops @ Bob Korn Imaging.

LOCATION: Center for Digital Imaging Arts at Boston University
Center for Digital Imaging Arts
274 Moody Street
Waltham, MA 02453

PROGRAM

Friday, April 27

Image Competition; 6:30pm–9:30pm

Saturday, April 28
Registration; 8:30am–9:30am
Dan Saelinger; 9:30am–12:30pm
Lunch break; 12:30pm–1:30pm
Victoria Will; 1:30pm–4:00pm

Sunday, April 29
Registration; 9:00am–10:00am
Program; 10:00am–5:00pm

Cost: CIPNE Members, Free; Non-members; Saturday, $95, Sunday, $125, Both days, $175; Full-time students, $20 each day. (Please note: the Image Competition judging session is open and free to all Conference attendees).

Pre-registration is required for this program. http://cipne.org/

Click here to register (Non-members may pay by PayPal) http://cipne.org
Please note: on-line registration closes April 26th.
